title: Can Skarner, Sejuani and Zac have their old kit back for S9?
body:
{{champion:72}} had a good rework and then it was decided to just shove Dominion into his kit when they axed the gamemode.
{{champion:113}} was fine, I don't care about diversity in LCS because I do not care at all about LCS.
{{champion:154}} was also fine and seemed to get changed to be more "exciting"(LCS?) when his original kit was enjoyable.


{{champion:57}} is an honorable mention. Not too sure what his deal was but I know that his healing is incredibly frustrating to deal with.

I used to play all 4 of these champions frequently and haven't really touched them since these reworks.

{{champion:98}} Also this guy lol

While something can be said for his old ult, Zac's current Q is LEAPS AND BOUNDS better than anything his old Q could hope for. His R is also better in my opinion because _he's a tank_ and he should be CC'ing people, not bouncing around exploding people with %HP damage.
I just want the old Q back so I can play top lane Zac.

but his old ult was applying CC

his new ult is what's gotten Zac nerfed into shit tier because the only balance lever that matters for it is whether a charged E guarantees his R or not

Actually, it's more the new Q that got him nerved, haveing that extra hard-cc+displace on top of his longranged E makes his ganks incredible hard to deal with.
If old Zac missed the E, all he got was an ok slow. When new Zac misses his E, he still gets to pull you in and CC for ~1sec in the process

Exactly, his Q is shittier design. 
Basically always guaranteed a kill no matter what as long as minions are close.

In what way? There was margin of error (you could knock enemy bruisers onto your carries eg darius or yi), knock targets away (eg the adc or apc) and unlike current zac ult, it could actually be stopped.
CC zac and he bounces in place. currently he is unstoppable, literally. 
Not to mention, the hourglass synergy.

So while this next bit is subjective, it was so much more fun and climactic than the thing we have now. He was more liquidy and flowy . his current R just, isn;'t

> [{quoted}](name=Oleandervine,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gEy0J3eY,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-11-12T22:00:08.352+0000)
>
> While something can be said for his old ult, Zac's current Q is LEAPS AND BOUNDS better than anything his old Q could hope for. His R is also better in my opinion because _he's a tank_ and he should be CC'ing people, not bouncing around exploding people with %HP damage.

So wrong here. Zac's old Q was a reliable poke and aoe for wave clear, so that he could function in the role where he had his highest win rate, which is top. Second, he was never a tank. No armor/res buffs, no shields, and no mitigation. Zac was an AP sustain bruiser, and functioned and itemized similar to an AP Darius. The new Q is really cool, but the Q + R cost us wave clear, damage, and sustain to pay for the cc. Not worth. You were clearly never a Zac main. 

If his new Q and R are so much better and more fun, then why did he go from 2% play rate pre rework all the way up to 2% play rate post rework? They just traded a small group of Zac mains for a different small group who enjoy playing a sub 50% jungle only support.

> [{quoted}](name=nGio,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gEy0J3eY,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2018-11-13T07:48:54.480+0000)
>
> So wrong here. Zac's old Q was a reliable poke and aoe for wave clear, so that he could function in the role where he had his highest win rate, which is top. Second, he was never a tank. No armor/res buffs, no shields, and no mitigation. Zac was an AP sustain bruiser, and functioned and itemized similar to an AP Darius. The new Q is really cool, but the Q + R cost us wave clear, damage, and sustain to pay for the cc. Not worth. You were clearly never a Zac main. 
> 
> If his new Q and R are so much better and more fun, then why did he go from 2% play rate pre rework all the way up to 2% play rate post rework? They just traded a small group of Zac mains for a different small group who enjoy playing a sub 50% jungle only support.

Zac has almost always been building heavy HP items, and while his AP scalings were decent, the sole reason his W is %HP damage and not flat damage is so that he could build tank items and not be required to build AP items in order to be a functional threat. Just because he doesn't have armor, shields, and damage mitigation doesn't mean he's not a tank. That's not actually what makes a tank a tank - they are supposed to be huge bodies that disrupt and CC the enemy team, and survive so that they can't be ignored. This is where Zac's healing blobules come in, as well as his built in GA. He very much IS a tank, so I have no idea why you are sitting here trying to claim he isn't.

Darius isn't a tank. Garen isn't a tank. Mordekaiser isn't a tank. Vlad isn't a tank. Swain isn't a tank. They're all bruisers, because they have extremely limited CC and their main function is to deal heavy sustained damage to their enemies. Zac doesn't fit in this line up because the majority of his kit is CC peppered with %HP damage - something you'll also notice bruisers don't have on demand.

As for his old Q, it was garbage. There is no other word for it, just plain garbage. He shot his arm out and slowed you, dealing insignificant damage and not even a significant slow. His new Q not only slows, but it has the added bonus of hard CC'ing enemies too if you can catch 2 of them. That alone improves it - because let's face it, Zac has never used his Q for wave clear, it's always been his W, since it deals better damage and is on a shorter cooldown.

> [{quoted}](name=Oleandervine,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gEy0J3eY,comment-id=0000000000010000,timestamp=2018-11-13T15:15:14.170+0000)
>
This is where Zac's healing blobules come in, as well as his built in GA. He very much IS a tank, so I have no idea why you are sitting here trying to claim he isn't.
> 

Healing doesn't make you a tank, and neither does a GA passive, or Yi and Anivia would be tanks.

> Darius isn't a tank. Garen isn't a tank. Mordekaiser isn't a tank. Vlad isn't a tank. Swain isn't a tank. They're all bruisers, because they have extremely limited CC and their main function is to deal heavy sustained damage to their enemies. Zac doesn't fit in this line up because the majority of his kit is CC peppered with %HP damage - something you'll also notice bruisers don't have on demand.

Are WW and Gragas tanks now too then? Builds health, multiple forms of cc, and % HP damage doesn't make you a tank. Zac's highest win % build included old Liandry's both in the jungle and top lane, and it was his core damage item, like Black Cleaver was for AD bruisers. There was probably a place deep in the wood tiers, where he didn't build Liandry's.

> 
> As for his old Q, it was garbage. There is no other word for it, just plain garbage. He shot his arm out and slowed you, dealing insignificant damage and not even a significant slow. His new Q not only slows, but it has the added bonus of hard CC'ing enemies too if you can catch 2 of them. That alone improves it - because let's face it, Zac has never used his Q for wave clear, it's always been his W, since it deals better damage and is on a shorter cooldown.

The problem with his new Q is that to get it, we had to give up everything else that made Zac what he was. He lost damage, sustain, and the ability to lane. He also became a balance nightmare, after years of being at 50-51% win rate, with 1-2% pick rate.

The day that the Zac rework went in, I was Plat with Zac being my most played at 68% win rate. Was Zac your most played too? No, he wasn't. There was a joke on the Zac sub reddit that the only people who referred to him as a 'tank' were people from the League forums, who didn't play him, and were completely unaware that AP bruisers existed or what they were.

Yeah why playing an interesting tank when you can get the new innovative CCs you for eternity on every ability zac. 
Same with seju btw.

Riot, if you're listening, REVERT these reworks!

As a guy who has enjoyed every iteration of Skarner since I joined back in season 3, I actually don't mind and enjoy this version, even with the problems.

I will agree on pretty much all the others though.
Same to the assassin reworks.....except for LB (please rework her again) and Akali.

Tbh pre RW talon was not much better. Nor was katarina.
While they're sub optimal currently, the goal of making them less insanity inducing to face was achieved

Except in the case of Kat it wasn't really. She's more oppressive now than she was before. Although I won't deny that she's currently sub-optimal. Still, her rework was and still is easily the most perplexing since it's not _bad_ but it brought with it a ton of new issues.

I kinda agree with Talon, but boy oh boy did they make quite the cheesy little bugger in lane.

I got the hang of dealing with kat when I took time to understand how her daggers behaved (in where they land, it's similar to zed ult how he always appears behind you). This makes her slightly more predictable. 
The whole walking on daggers for free damage is silly doe.

LB needs her E to work like kled Q, no stealth on passive and her W needs a 1 second delay on returning.
Remove true invis from akali. OR crush the rest of her kit into the ground. IDC which
Kayne (not part of the update) needs R nerfs. His ult acting as damage, invincibility and an obscene heal is way too much.
Ekko needs his passive nerfed.
not sure on shaco
Zed is fine at this point.

I agree with your changes to LB. I disagree with your change to Kayn, they just need to nerf his Q so that he's a slightly slower clearer, that's the real issue with him.
I agree with Ekko. I disagree with you saying Zed is fine, he definitely needs some give and take changes as compensation to the massive buff to his Q.

As for Shaco, just revert him.

Maokai ult rework:

Natures Grasp: Removed
Fury of the Forest: new
First cast: Maokai roots himself in place and sends thorny brambles surging out in all directions, rooting+damaging champions they come into contact with, revealing and marking them as caught for the root duration. I'm thinking this will travel at the speed off Ornns ultimate (not sure which one though, as ornns second cast is faster than the first. But maybe too fast for this.)

Second cast: Maokai brings his branches to a halt and hauls all "caught" enemies towards him. Stopping halfway between Maokai and the point at which they were caught (this animation will be super quick, so like blitzcrank quick. Not urgot quick). If it wasn't clear, second cast stops the ult in it's tracks (so no more people will be rooted after this)
Damage: unchanged so 100/200/300. Will deal no damage on second cast.
Range: I'm thinking 2/3 of an Ornn ultimate

There are many champs that I hope that they go back and visit (LB, Rengar, Kindred, Malz...who else?), to see what they can improve upon, lets not get too focused on the highlights of some misteps cause there are a few in the shadows, and lets not forget some of the changes that were actually good!

Shen will always be tough to work with due to the nature of his ult, tbh he's not that bad and certainly not the worst. Maokai also come out of the reworks much for the better theres really nothing wrong with him, if JG mao needs help just give him some extra dmg on camps and he's fine.

For Skarner they kno they misstepped as someone already pointed out they are looking for a new passive.

For Zac the only problem seems to be his ult, theres less margin of error and its CC potential is takes a lot of his power budget (though I DO have to ask what got nerfed in exchange since his dmg doesn't matter as a tank)
Im starting to understand that for Zac mains losing the FUN of his old ult seems to be the real sore spot for them, so they need to find the middle ground between the fun of the old ult and some of the utility of the new ult. Its simple Bouncing is fun. 

Now Sej, her issue is the major misstep in terms of how they decided she should contribute to a team. Making her a CC bot has turned out to be super unhealthy so they definitely need to revisit her and see what her E can provide to the team outside of hard CC that can enable and encourage the team to follow her into battle. If her E isn't hard CC then she can get her old ult back, but hopfully the new E is something engaging.

But YEAH i really hope that they STOP making or balancing champs for LCS, or making champs that have to be balanced for LCS. Ultimately its won't work in the end b/c either they have to be nerfed/buff for LCS which means they don't get played or they get banned cause no one wants to deal with it.

mao was kind of okay at first but the full ap support shit that needed to be nerfed also killed jgl mao and left top maokai in a very meh state
skarner has been a dead champ to me after the juggernaut update

I personally enjoy zacs new kit and have played him alot. The past season has just not been favourable for tanks due to the extreme skirmishing required to be viable.

Yes to Skarner, PLEASE.

 Sej I don't know, I just know I don't like playing the current one. 

No to Zac, or at least only revert his ult because his new Q is way more interesting than "generic aoe slow". You can say it gutted top Zac but you can find ways to tweak his abilities if Riot want to make him a top laner.

The only real difference with Maokai and his previous version is his ult. His healing is so strong because he lost the resistance boost from his old ult. I don't think either iteration is all that different in terms of durability.

His new (W I think?) blind zone is interesting but I do find his spirit sword wonky. However I don't think reverting him accomplishes anything as his old kit needed a rework (At least he needed a new Q).
In terms of Zac I think there's a point where simplicity is bliss. Over complicating things in an unnecessary manner kinda ruins Zac right now.
